channel.title: Blog on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Cannot read property ‚ÄògraphiteVersion‚Äô of null
item.description: After upgrading to 0.99f version, you get this error on any dashboard: Starting from Grafana 4.5, the version of the graphite datasource is mandatory and that‚Äôs why we update a record in the sqlite database during the upgrade process. For a small population of users, this record is not updated for an unknown reason. To correct that issue, you simply need to force the ‚Äú0.9‚Äù version in the graphite datasource:

item.title: You are now using version 0_99f "Traptown"!
item.description: Today we are proud to announce the release of the sixth SexiGraf update: 0.99f codename ‚ÄúTraptown‚Äù Edit 29 may 2019: For the few of you that would encounter this issue after upgrading, please refer to this post for a fix: In this new version, we‚Äôve added the support of the new vSAN 6.7U1 API (included in the 0.99e1 emergency patch). New features SuperStats vCenter Bad Events Early Storage Pod (aka Datastore Cluster) support Grafana 4.

item.title: How Simple Became Complicated
item.description: Few months ago, we had the amazing opportunity to deploy SexiGraf in a *BIG* company. Think petabytes scale. In the past, we have already been challenged to make our tool scalable, but not that much: 50+ vCenter 6000+ ESX 115000+ VM 18000+ datastores 1000+ clusters 200ms+ network latency for half vCenter After many hours of hard work, almost total rewrite of our code and a massive use of hash tables, we are proud to show you a sneak peek of the next SexiGraf version (0.

item.title: vSAN dashboards empty after vSphere 6_7U1 update
item.description: Due to some unexpected changes in the vSAN 6.7U1 APIs, your SexiGraf appliance won‚Äôt be able to fetch vSAN metrics after updating your vCenter in 6.7.0 build 10244857 (aka U1). You‚Äôll also get this error in the log: DIE Can‚Äôt call method ‚ÄúapiType‚Äù on an undefined value at /root/VsanPullStatistics.pl line 136. Today we‚Äôre releasing a quick fix (0.99e1) on top of the 0.99e version, meaning you CAN‚ÄôT apply this fix on previous version.

item.title: You are now using version 0_99e "White Forest"!
item.description: Today we are proud to announce the release of the fifth SexiGraf update: 0.99e codename ‚ÄúWhite Forest‚Äù In this new version, we‚Äôve added the support of the new vSphere 6.7 & vSAN 6.7 APIs. New features SexiGraf data Export & Import vmhba traffic in cluster dashboards VM network usage (bandwidth) VM disk usage (bandwidth) vCenter Active Sessions (per user) Enhancements and fixes VSAN Resync dashboard boost (per reason) Network errors and dropped counters Early HTTPS support Wrong mem.

item.title: Welcome to Nova Prospekt
item.description: Today we are very proud to announce the release of the fourth SexiGraf update: 0.99d codename ‚ÄúNova Prospekt‚Äù In this new version, we‚Äôve added the support of the new vSphere 6.5 & vSAN 6.6 APIs. We also embed the very up to date Grafana 4.3 and all the Debian 8.8 packages upgrades for security concerns. New features Multi Cluster Top N VM Snapshot (many thanks to Jo for this great idea) All|Multi Datastore Usage Distribution Multi Cluster vCPU pCPU All|Multi Cluster Top N VM Latency Multi Cluster Top N VMFS Latency SAN Monitor 2nd FTT VSAN Monitor ‚Äú66‚Äù (resyncRead & client.

item.title: You are now using version 0_99c "Citadel"!
item.description: Today we are proud to announce the release of the third SexiGraf update: 0.99c codename ‚ÄúCitadel‚Äù In this new version, we‚Äôve added the support of the new VSAN 6.2 API but also FreeNAS and Windows! New features VSAN Space Usage Report FreeNAS SexiPanel Windows SexiPanel VMware VSAN AF Monitor Multi VSAN Monitor Enhancements and fixes VSAN witness support removed (no useful stats) T10 support in VSAN NAA Latency dashboard Handle PerformanceManager spikes Various bug fix OVF properties support To upgrade your existing appliance go get the SexiGraf Update Package on GitHub and use it in the Package Updater (you won‚Äôt lost any data of course).

item.title: Big Scale Ability
item.description: You may wonder how big you can go with SexiGraf? It turns out you already got the answer in your question: BIG Check out how many ESXi and VM you can monitor with a single SexiGraf appliance: Yes, this is 968 ESX, 12405 VMs, 155 TB of RAM and 1.7 PB of storage over 18 vCenters. We only pushed up the appliance to 8 vCPU and 16GB of vRAM to support the load.

item.title: You are now using version 0_99b1 "Xen"!
item.description: Today we are proud to announce the release of the second SexiGraf update: 0.99b1 codename ‚ÄúXen‚Äù Edit 10 feb 2016: For those of you who downloaded the previous version 0.99b, please apply the 0.99b1 patched version. You can check your current version in the Package Updater admin module. New features vSphere Top N VM Stats vSphere Top N VM Overcommit VSAN Resync VSAN NAA Latency VSAN DiskGroup Capacity Enhancements and fixes

item.title: You are now using version 0_99a "City 17"!
item.description: Today we are proud to announce the release of the first SexiGraf update: 0.99a codename ‚ÄúCity 17‚Äú New features VSAN Top N vmdk Cluster Multi ESX LiteStats Enhancements and fixes House Cleaner Log Viewer Authentication fix Various bug fix To upgrade your existing appliance go get the SexiGraf Update Package on GitHub and use it in the Package Updater (you won‚Äôt lost any data of course).

item.title: Cannot complete login
item.description: If you suffer from a PEBCAK disease, you might encounter a ‚ÄúCannot complete login due to an incorrect user name or password‚Äù error. In that case, please remove you ski gloves and try again üôÇ

item.title: The roooooooot situation
item.description: If you got this behavior, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre in a RDP or ICA session trying to enter your root credentials. The only way to work around is the famous VMware KB Repeated characters when typing in remote console: keyboard.typematicMinDelay = "2000000"
